content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the final simplified passage

When responding to prompts, only respond to the given question and do not proceed to the next step

The passage:
Based on the Inception-v3 architecture, our system performs better in terms of processing complexity and accuracy than many existing models for imitation learning.

DC: University student
ILT: Medium
Identify which parts of the text are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The most complex parts of the text are:
- "Inception-v3 architecture"
- "many existing models for imitation learning"

The complexity level of the passage is High.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage. Remember to respect the ILT (Medium) contraint. Only provide the identified section
"Inception-v3 architecture"
Simplify this section. Only provide the proposed simplification
"Modified Inception architecture"
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
Based on the Modified Inception architecture, our system performs better in terms of processing complexity and accuracy than many existing models for imitation learning.

Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original. Comparison must be between the originally provided (the very first) passage and the current simplified version. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The information loss in the updated passage is that the specific name "Inception-v3" is replaced by a more general term "Modified Inception architecture". The severity of this information loss is Medium, as the original term refers to a specific architecture, while the simplified term is more generic. This change may cause some loss of precision in understanding the system's architecture. However, the overall meaning of the passage remains intact. The severity of information loss is within the tolerated threshold (ILT: Medium).
What is the highest severity level identified in your last answer? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Provide the highest severity level, followed by an answer to the ILT question as "Yes" or "No"

Medium
No
Identify which parts of the text are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The most complex parts of the text are:
- "processing complexity and accuracy"

The complexity level of the passage is High.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage. Remember to respect the ILT (Medium) contraint. Only provide the identified section
"processing complexity and accuracy"
Simplify this section. Only provide the proposed simplification
"processing speed and accuracy"
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
Based on the Modified Inception architecture, our system performs better in terms of processing speed and accuracy than many existing models for imitation learning.

Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original. Comparison must be between the originally provided (the very first) passage and the current simplified version. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The information loss in the updated passage is that the phrase "processing complexity" is replaced by "processing speed", losing some precision in the description of the system's performance. The severity of this information loss is Low, as the change is a subtle shift in wording. However, the overall meaning of the passage remains intact. The severity of information loss is within the tolerated threshold (ILT: Medium). The change is relatively minor, so it does not significantly impact the understanding of the passage.
What is the highest severity level identified in your last answer? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Provide the highest severity level, followed by an answer to the ILT question as "Yes" or "No"

Low
Yes
Revert the last proposed change. In further iterations you may still attempt to simplify this section in other ways

The passage is reverted to:
Based on the Modified Inception architecture, our system performs better in terms of processing complexity and accuracy than many existing models for imitation learning.
Identify which parts of the text are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The most complex parts of the text are:
- "Modified Inception architecture"
- "processing complexity and accuracy"
- "many existing models for imitation learning"

The complexity level of the passage is High.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage. Remember to respect the ILT (Medium) contraint. Only provide the identified section
"Modified Inception architecture"
Simplify this section. Only provide the proposed simplification
"Modified Inception"
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
Based on the Modified Inception, our system performs better in terms of processing complexity and accuracy than many existing models for imitation learning.

Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original. Comparison must be between the originally provided (the very first) passage and the current simplified version. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The information loss in the updated passage is that the word "architecture" is removed, potentially losing some nuance in the description of the system. The severity of this information loss is Low, as the change is a minor reduction in specificity. However, the overall meaning of the passage remains intact. The severity of information loss is within the tolerated threshold (ILT: Medium). The change is relatively minor, so it does not significantly impact the understanding of the passage.
What is the highest severity level identified in your last answer? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Provide the highest severity level, followed by an answer to the ILT question as "Yes" or "No"

Low
No
Identify which parts of the text are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The most complex parts of the text are:
- "processing complexity and accuracy"
- "many existing models for imitation learning"

The complexity level of the passage is Medium.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
Print the final version of the simplified passage, include only the text of the passage with no comments or additional punctuation, and do not provide the original passage
Based on the Modified Inception, our system performs better in terms of processing complexity and accuracy than many existing models for imitation learning.
